item.description: The Free & Open Source Space Flight Organization

item.title: About FOSSFO
item.description:
Vision

Big thinkers, innovating and reaching for the stars from basements and garages, launching spaceflight to new heights with their inventions and shared ideas.

Mission

To create a community and open source tools that spark interest and creativity in modern spaceflight.

Founders

Zach, The Citizen Astronaut and Brandon, the Sovereign Sysadmin founded FOSSFO in April 2025. After seeing his first in-person shuttle launch, Zach was immediately hooked on spaceflight and began sharing his new passion on TikTok and elsewhere. He quickly enlisted the help of Brandon, a former colleague with a huge passion for Linux and open source. The pair had been discussing starting an open source project for several years, and this is the one that finally launched!

item.title: Personal Ground Control (PGC)
item.description:
About

Personal Ground Control (PGC) is a multiphased project designed to put you in full control of the rocket launch experience. What sets PGC apart is its pioneering features: a launchpad compass and a real-time sound delay timer that predicts exactly when you’ll hear the rocket. We also plan to implement augmented reality enhancements that display rocket trajectories along with color-coded phase indicators for key events like booster separation. Additionally, a pan/tilt phone cradle is under development to automatically track the rocket, freeing you from staring at your screen to capture the perfect video. With PGC, the launch is yours to enoyâ€”the app handles the technical details so you can stay present in the moment.
